title: SaaSkit Core Framework
description:
The foundational `<SaaS>` component and render function pattern. Implements the core abstraction where everything is Nouns + Verbs.

Key deliverables:
- `<SaaS name="..." />` JSX component
- `SaaS({...})` function API (same export, dual usage)
- Child function pattern: `{$ => { $.nouns(...); $.verbs(...) }}`
- TypeScript types for SaaSConfig, Noun definitions, Verb definitions
- Relationship operators: `->`, `~>`, `<-`, `<~`
- Verb anatomy: action, activity, event, reverse, inverse
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] `<SaaS>` component renders and accepts children function
- [ ] `SaaS({})` function returns config object
- [ ] $.nouns() registers noun definitions with types
- [ ] $.verbs() registers verb handlers
- [ ] Relationship operators parsed correctly
- [ ] Full TypeScript inference for $ context
- [ ] Export both JSX and function from same entry point

title: SaaSkit $ Context System
description:
The `$` context object that provides access to all Platform.do primitives. This is the developer's handle to everything.

Key deliverables:
- $.db - Database operations (CRUD, search, semanticSearch)
- $.ai - Template literal for AI generation
- $.agents - Named AI workers
- $.human - Human-in-the-loop (approve, ask, review)
- $.send / $.do - Durable event/action dispatch
- $.api - 9000+ integrations
- $.input, $.record, $.id - Verb context
- $.user, $.org, $.env - Auth/org/env context
- $.time, $.crypto, $.log - Utilities

title: SaaSkit AI Integration (Functions.do + Agents.do)
description:
Integration with Functions.do and Agents.do for AI capabilities.

Key deliverables:
- $.ai`prompt` - Template literal for generative AI
- $.agent() - Define named agents with instructions + tools
- $.agents.[name].run() - Execute agent
- $.human.approve() - Human approval flow
- $.human.ask() - Ask human a question
- $.human.review() - Human reviews content
- AIPromise pipelining (no await until needed)
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] $.ai template literal generates content
- [ ] $.agent() defines agents with instructions/tools
- [ ] Agents can call verbs as tools
- [ ] $.human.approve() creates approval queue item
- [ ] Human responses flow back to waiting code
- [ ] AIPromise pipelining works

title: SaaSkit Integrations Layer (APIs.do)
description:
Integration with APIs.do for 9000+ pre-built integrations and $.integrate() for configuration.

Key deliverables:
- $.api.[service].[method]() - Call external APIs
- $.integrate() - Configure integrations (API keys, OAuth)
- Built-in services: emails, texts, calls (Communication primitives)
- Built-in payments: stripe (Payments.do)
- Common integrations: slack, apollo, hubspot, etc.
- Auto-publish to Zapier (your SaaS becomes an integration)
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] $.api provides typed access to services
- [ ] $.integrate() stores credentials securely
- [ ] $.api.emails/texts/calls work with Platform.do
- [ ] $.api.stripe works with Payments.do
- [ ] OAuth flows work for services that need it
- [ ] Zapier app auto-generated from nouns/verbs

title: GREEN: Core Framework implementation
description:
Implement the core SaaSkit framework to make RED tests pass.

Implementation:
- SaaS component with children function pattern
- SaaS function that returns same config
- $ context builder with nouns/verbs registration
- Relationship operator parser
- Verb anatomy generator
- TypeScript types for full inference
notes:
GREEN phase complete - all 17 tests in saas.test.tsx passing

Implementation includes:
- SaaS component with children function pattern `{$ => {...}}`
- $ context with nouns() and verbs() registration methods
- Field type parsing (string, number, boolean, markdown, optional with ?)
- Relationship operator parsing (->, <-, ~>, <~) with cardinality
- Verb anatomy generation (action, activity, event, reverse, inverse)
- Event registration via $.on.Noun.verb pattern (proxy-based)
- Schedule registration via $.every.day.at('9am') pattern (proxy-based)
- Dual-use: works as JSX component AND as function returning config
- Uses stack trace detection to distinguish React render vs function call

Key internal properties exposed for testing:
- $._registeredNouns
- $._registeredVerbs
- $._verbAnatomy
- $._parsedRelations
- $._registeredEvents
- $._registeredSchedules
close_reason: GREEN phase complete - 17/17 Core Framework tests passing

title: SaaSkit Events & Schedules (Workflows.do Integration)
description:
Integration with Workflows.do / ai-workflows for event handling and scheduled tasks.

Key deliverables:
- $.on.[Noun].[event]() - Event handlers
- $.every.[schedule]() - Recurring tasks
- $.send() - Fire and forget (durable)
- $.do() - Wait for result (durable)
- Auto-emit events when verbs complete (e.g., Order.paid after pay verb)
- Schedule patterns: every.day.at9am, every.Monday, every.hour, etc.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] $.on.Noun.event() registers handlers
- [ ] Events auto-fire after verb completion
- [ ] $.every.* patterns all work
- [ ] $.send() is fire-and-forget durable
- [ ] $.do() waits for result durable
- [ ] Handlers receive event data and $ context
